FuncDef:
The timer retry command sets the interval for retrying to set up a Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) peer relationship.
The undo timer retry command restores the default value. The timer retry command sets the interval for retrying to set up a Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) peer relationship. The undo timer retry command restores the default value. By default, the interval for retrying to set up an MSDP peer relationship is 30 seconds.
ParentView: VPN instance MSDP view,MSDP view of a public network instance

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the interval for retrying to set up an MSDP peer relationship.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 60, in seconds.

ExtraInfo: The TCP connection needs to be set up between the MSDP peers. MSDP requires the peer with the larger IP address to listen at the port 639, and the peer with the smaller IP address to start a connection. If the connection fails, the peer restarts the connection after a period of time. Such a period of time is called interval retrying to set up an MSDP peer relationship.
